q1_general_response: {"answer": "The lesion is a dark brown color and has an irregular, elongated shape. There appears to be some variation in pigmentation within the lesion."}
q2_dataset_response: {"answer": "Based on the image, it appears to be a melanocytic nevus (mole). It is a benign growth of melanocytes, the cells that produce melanin (pigment) in the skin. The mole has a somewhat oval shape with fairly well-defined borders and a range of brown hues. While it doesn't exhibit obvious concerning features in this single image, it's important to monitor moles for any changes in size, shape, color, or the development of new symptoms like itching or bleeding. Any concerning changes should be evaluated by a dermatologist to rule out melanoma."}
